name: mythologically
content:
mythologically adverb
(IN STORIES)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is connected with myths or mythology (= ancient stories): Nature is often mythologically portrayed as a hostile force. Mythologically, the duality of human nature is often expressed in stories about twins.
More examplesFewer examplesMythologically, the forest has a powerful significance.

(FALSELY)
in a way that is commonly believed, but that is untrue: The story examines and questions their mythologically superior moral values. Football, mythologically, is described as a sport only for the working classes.
